alert.note: Alert for Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 12:47PM PST until January 04 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather Returns Tonight through Early Tuesday... .Another weather system will bring snow to the mountains of interior NorCal tonight into early this week. The heaviest snow will occur over the foothills and mountains to the north of Redding late tonight into Monday evening. Significant travel impacts will be possible on Interstate 5 north of Redding. Lighter snowfall accumulations will impact travel over the Southern Cascades and Northern Sierra Nevada on Monday into early Tuesday. Strong winds will also accompany this weather system and could cause limited visibility at times as well as downed tree branches and weakened trees. If you`re planning travel over the mountains early this week, stay in touch with the latest forecasts. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM MONDAY TO 7 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute on Monday. Damage to trees and power lines is possible due to snow and strong winds. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches, with localized amounts up to 1 to 2 feet, are expected. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park. * WHEN...7 AM Monday to 7 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for wet snow means periods of wet snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
